repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: John Howard, born June 12, 1962, is a Professor of American Studies at King's College London. The collection represents the papers of John Howard, including personal papers, professional papers, oral histories, and audiovisual materials. It includes materials on his research and writings on Southern American gender and sexuality studies, particularly gay men.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48-hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], John Howard Papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The John Howard Papers were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2013.

Materials may not have been ordered and described beyond their original condition.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: John Howard, born June 12, 1962, is a Professor of American Studies at King's College London. He completed his undergraduate work at University of Virginia, receiving his MBA from University of Mississippi, his MA in American Studies at University of Alabama, and his PhD in American Studies from Emory University. Howard was the first externally hired full-time director of the Duke LGBT student center.

His work focuses on queer history, documentary photography, Japanese-American and African-American histories, nuclear proliferation and protest, and the American South. Howard was the co-author and signatory of the Historians' Amicus Brief, Supreme Court, Lawrence v. Texas, in 2003. He has received awards and commendations from Fulbright Commission, Rockefeller Foundation, Arts and Humanities Research Council, Delfina Studio Trust amongst others. Howard is involved with a number of activist organizations, including Queer Nation and the campaign to Free Chelsea Manning.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The John Howard Papers collection is comprised of five series: Personal Papers, Professional Papers, Writings, Oral Histories and Audiovisual Materials. The materials detail Howard's professional life, with undergraduate and graduate work, activism and his professional career forming the core of the collection.

The Personal Papers Series consists of items from his early life, including diplomas and test scores, undergraduate paper topics and a playlist for his band. It also includes the UK immigration case paperwork for Howard's former partner, Novid Parsi.

The Professional Papers Series is divided into eight subseries: professional files, activist organizations, conferences, research, clippings, correspondence, teaching, and miscellaneous. Consisting of two boxes, this is the largest series in the collection. Howard's professional files include grants, presentations, promotions, etc. His work with various activist organizations include files for particular organizations as well as files documenting his role in protests, marches, and other events. Conference files include promotional literature, correspondence, and notes from a variety of professional and community group conferences. Howard's research subseries contains many hand-written notes on a number of subjects ranging from Shirley Q. Liquor to sodomy. Clippings consists of newspaper clippings and printouts collected on LGBTQI topics in various regions in the country. Teaching and syllabi include not only Howard's syllabi from undergraduate work, but also syllabi, teaching evaluations and correspondence from his own teaching career at institutions such as Duke University, DeKalb College, King's College London, and University of York.

The Writing Series is divided into two series: Writings by Howard and Writings by Others. Writings by Howard includes notes, correspondence, releases and reviews of Howard's published books, articles and other chapter publications. Writing by Others includes bound stage and screen plays, and unpublished manuscripts. The works were given to Howard by the authors.

The Oral History Series contains oral history notes from about twenty-five interviewees. Relatedly, the Audiovisual Materials Series consists of thirty-three audiocassettes containing oral history interviews for Howard's book, Men Like That.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The Personal Papers Series includes items such as gallery/art show pamphlets, Novid Parsi's immigration file, a playlist for the Band Defunkt, diplomas, GRE/GMAT reports, and miscellaneous undergraduate paper topics. The series is arranged in alphabetical order.

did.unittitle: The Band Defunkt, playlist, Washington, DC 1986
"Icons of the Gay Community," Getty Image Gallery, 2005

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The Professional Papers Series is divided into eight subseries: professional, activist organizations, conferences, research, clippings, correspondence, teaching and miscellaneous. Each subseries is arranged in alphabetical order.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Box 5 includes items restricted according to the University Archives regulations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials include invitations to speak at universities, grants, presentations, guest lectures, documentaries, items pertaining to his tenure at The National Faculty, promotions, seminars, letters of recommendation, and the Historians' Amicus Brief, Supreme Court, Lawrence v. Texas.

Center for Gay and Lesbian Studies, 1992-1995
The Joys and Limits of Gay Sex (chats), 2001
Lawrence vs. Texas, Historians' Amicus Brief, 2003

Letters of recommendation for J. Howard, 1998
Southern Culture Collaborative Program, High Museum, 1996
Swearer Center for Public Service, Brown University, 1995

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Organizations represented include Atlanta Lesbian and Gay History Thing, The Gay, Lesbian and Bisexual Alliance of the University of Alabama, Mary Renault Society, Queer Nation, amongst others. The subseries also consists of the activist events pertaining to the Cracker Barrel.

did.unittitle: Atlanta Lesbian and Gay History Thing, undated
Atlanta Lesbian and Gay Public Safety Task Force, 1992
Lesbian, Gay, and Bisexual Student Leaders meeting, 1992
Gay, Lesbian, and Bisexual Alliance and the University of Alabama, 1996

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conferences organized include Queer Matters Conference and Sex Show Conference; conferences attended include the Queer History Conference, the Southern Conference on Afro-American Studies, and several others. Files arranged alphabetically by title.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This subseries includes research on subjects such as sodomy, Shirley Q. Liquor, U.S. President James Buchanan, and also includes photos from a Delta State Yearbook. Files arranged alphabetically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Clippings concern LGBTQI issues in Alabama, Atlanta/Emory University, and Duke University. Also includes clippings on non-gay issues in the south.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence with other authors, students, and fans. Files arranged alphabetically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes not only syllabi from Howard's graduate studies, but also syllabi, teaching evaluations and correspondence from Howard's tenure at King's College London, York University, Duke University and DeKalb among others.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Items include a picture, some handwritten quotes and a written tribute to Ruby Etta Lee Koppelman authored by her daughter, Nancy Koppelman.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Box 6 includes items restricted according to the University Archives policies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes notes, correspondence and reviews of Howard's published work. Works include Carryin' on in the Lesbian and Gay South, The Bitterweed Path, and Men Like That: A Southern Queer History. Works are arranged in alphabetical order by title.

did.unittitle: Carryin' On in the Lesbian and Gay South anthology, 1993-1997
Lesbian, Gay, and Bisexual Community Studies, 1996
The Library, the Park, and the Pervert, 1992

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Series includes bound stage and screen plays, and unpublished manuscripts--given by the authors to Howard. Authors include Patrick Cather, Ben Duncan, Novid Parsi, among others. Also included are two printed reports by organizations. Works are arranged in alphabetical order by author.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Comprises oral history notes for Howard's research, including the work Men Like That, A Southern Queer History. The interviews were conducted by either John Howard or the Mississippi Oral History Program at The University of Southern Mississippi, abbreviated JH and MOHP respectively.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Series contains thirty-three audio-cassettes with oral history interviews for Men Like That, A Southern Queer History.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: [Original audiovisual materials are closed to use. Use of these materials may require production of listening or viewing copies. Please contact Research Services before coming to use this collection.]
